instruction: What metric was chosen to investigate the status of apple mosaic disease and monitor its degree and how far can this metric go in the research?

The metric chosen to estimate the degree of apple mosaic disease in the related research is the content of anthocyanin in the apple leaves. The researchers used hyperspectral imaging technology to obtain spectral differences between healthy and infected leaves, and simultaneously measured the anthocyanin content. They developed an optimal model to estimate the anthocyanin content and determine the degree of apple mosaic disease.

In terms of the research, the metric of anthocyanin content was found to be effective in monitoring the degree of apple mosaic disease. The researchers observed that as the degree of disease increased, the infected leaves exhibited stronger reflectance at a range of 500-560 nm. By analyzing the spectral reflectance processed by the Gaussian1 wavelet transform, the correlation between the reflectance and anthocyanin content was significantly improved compared to the original spectrum.

The VPs-XGBoost anthocyanin estimation model performed the best in estimating the anthocyanin content and monitoring the degree of the disease. This suggests that the chosen metric of anthocyanin content, along with the remote sensing technology used, can provide a quantitative estimation of leaf anthocyanin content and effectively monitor the degree of apple mosaic disease.
